Posts.Content: Thank you Tweets20 I am trying my best to get an appointment that has already been cancelled 3 times! I telephoned BC nurses and was told I couldn't just pop in but had to wait for an appointment. I've had no ffollowup since rads ended Nov as I've been left off the list. My healthcare in my area is a joke but i have an appointment booked again for 3rd June so fingers crossed.
Posts.Title: Lumpy breast 18 months after lumpectomy and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Tweets20 was wondering how you got on with your lumpy boob? I had lumpectomy last July and finished rads last November. My boob now feels firmer and lumpy. Like you I'm not sure if it's in my head or effects of rads
Posts.Title: Lumpy breast 18 months after lumpectomy and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Yes it is an excellent system that avoids two operations unless I don't have clear margins but I'm prepared for that. There is still a niggle however as nobody actually told me anything after my opp. I will bring it up at my appointment
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: sunflower76 Thank you. what did you use 're creams gels wash etc during your radiotherapy? I also has 15 days to look forward to and a 40min drive each way!
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: thank you GRANNY59. sorry I have 2 wounds one where they removed the lump and the one below my arm pit. Yes the wait is a drag but I'm keeping busy and to be honest the time is flying by. keeping positive  xxxxxx
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Leolady56 I'm in South Wales. Yes definitely keeping fingers crossed x
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you. I think i will have to invest in some non purfume shower stuff and e45 as i usually smother myself in bodyshop lol I think I will be holding breath too as it's my left boob! I'm 53 have great skin and only have to look at the sun to tan so hope for the best. considering myself very lucky to have escaped chemotherapy but dreading the oestrogen suppression pills!  Pam x
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies. I already have crop tops but find it a little uncomfortable walking with the 'bounce' I have ordered a couple of Sarah bras through JD Williams. 97% cotton, seamless, non wired, front fastening. quite pretty from the front although like a sports bra(but that's fine for me) at the back. I will keep you updated when they arrive. XX
Posts.Title: Best bra after sentinal lymph node biopsy

Posts.Content: hi I'm new to the group. I had a lumpectomy for an 11mm lump and a sentinel node biopsy last Thursday. They said that the sentinel lymph nodes would be assessed during surgery. I have a wound under my arm where the side of my bra is but appear to have not had any further lymph nodes taken from either under my armpit or neck. this may be a silly question but in my mind if this had spread then they would have removed other lymph nodes. has anyone else had this
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi. I have my planning session next monday but have no date to start rads yet. I would imagine it's the following week. I've been extremely lucky to get away with just 15 and no chemo. looking forward to getting this started and consequently finished.  Good luck all xx
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Dizzy17 I'm aching a little around my lymph scar too! nothing that really bothers me and I'm not sure if it's because I'm waiting for something to happen but a little sharp jab in that area too. see you in November club x
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I have had two sentinel lymph node biopsy. The first time everything healed beautifully but now 4 weeks on and I've had another opp as the nodes had been missed. Its so painful and Im having so much trouble finding a seam free  bra that is high enough at the side without it rubbing on the wound. Has anyone got any suggestions?
Posts.Title: Best bra after sentinal lymph node biopsy

Posts.Content: well they had a second attempt at getting some lymph nodes out on Thursday and boy does it hurt! I don't think my surgeon was going to miss them again this time! I had a wire put in by radiologist who said she had never done one for lymph nodes before! and that they were quite deep but to her all looked perfectly normal. My surgeon is really beating himself up about it, he is such a perfectionist. I will have results on 10th of sep(very quick) so keeping fingers crossed I only need radiotherapy. I'm in so much more pain than when they did lumpectomy and original sentinel node biopsy but I suppose with no nodes it was just tissue then.
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Dizzy17 good luck with your treatment, I will be a day ahead of you
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: How is everyone getting on?
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: so much for the excellent system. Had my results and margins are clear but sentinel node biopsy is another story. After being told that this would be done and tested whilst on the table it appears I have confused my surgeon! in his 16years this has never happened before but the tissue he removed contained no lymph nodes! He thinks that lab have made a mistake but if not I'm in for another opp next week. doesn't fill me with confidence.
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady56 I had my planning appointment yesterday and was told that my treatment now won't start until 29th October! I had my lumpectomy 2nd August and another opp to get to lymph nodes on 30th August. I'm a little worried that this date is over 12 weeks since my lumpectomy and thoughts of what if any left over cells have started growing again! I just want to get on with this next stage of my treatment.
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: you are right those tattoos really hurt and I've had two other tattoos! how is your treatment going CaliP?
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: hi CaliP  I started Monday 29th so have had my 2nd zap today. No side effects so far and i take it realkt easy after work and make sure im in bef by 10pm. Only a little tired after the 40min each way drive but nothing to really worry about. xx
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: my diagnosis was July 18 just before I went on a 2 week holiday! we already had our holiday booked for July this year too as a dear friend was diagnosed with brain tumour just before my breast cancer diagnosis, we all thought it will be fine we will all go together. How wrong we were, we lost him. We are still going away in July with him in our memory and hearts. After my lumpectomy and radiotherapy, I had the opposite effect to you Galligirl in that I booked a further two holidays for this year! I figure that if I have my check at roughly same time as my diagnosis, I had a year to plan things. Sometimes I do have real lows but i need to keep looking forward to stop myself falling. Only those of us that have been through this can understand. I have real problems with my husband thinking or acting that treatment is over now let's get back to normal. it's impossible to make him understand that I will never be 'normal' again.
Posts.Title: A year

Posts.Content: Had the results back today and lymph nodes are all clear!!! I'm so happy. No chemotherapy for me but 15days radiotherapy and oestrogen suppression meds. I had early menopause at 40 with no symptoms! that will teach me.
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: hi Julesy1 I had my first treatment today. I was told to just keep using what my skin is used to. I've been using E45 since my opp but am now using simple shower gel and have bought pure aloe Vera just in case. they told me that I can moisturise before treatment as long as it's not plastered on. I didn't but did put E45 on when I got home. I wasn't offered anything to apply straight after. Good Luck XX
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi OCRKate I had 15 rads and finishes 10 weeks ago. I was told that effects could come up to 14 days after. I had a pink boob and one very small burn under arm that came out about 3weels after along with a very dark itchy nipple. I used E45 as much as I could and now 10 weeks on, nipple almost matches the other.
Posts.Title: Itchy Nipple - Normal or Something Bad?

Posts.Content: Shieldscannylass I qualified as a counsellor many years ago and used to volunteer with victim support. I too would like to now give something back x
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Lacca I totally agree with you. I had lumpectomy on a 12mm lump and 3 weeks radio. no lymph node involvement. I finished rads 9 weeks ago. I feel like I have just been left now. I've had no problems with operation or radiotherapy or Letrozol. I haven't seen my GP I just collect prescription I haven't heard from my breast care team and I was meant to have an appointment with my consultant mid Jan but I haven't heard a word. But at least I've had no problems eh!!!! Its the pits. Emotionally we have all been through hell.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: On reading posts on here I realise how little I really know about my breast cancer. After my mammogram came back inconclusive I went into freefall with Another mammogram and biopsy, until my diagnosis in July 2018.  All that I was told in that room was..it is cancer, its 11mm, its grade 111. We are looking at Lumpectomy and radiotherapy. I was sent away with a breast cancer care booklet that the BCN had marked with points that applied to me. Invasive breast cancer/invasive ductal breast cancer. Grade 3. Hormone receptor test(my cancer needs oestrogen to grow) HER2 test (I assume mine was negative as I didn't have chemotherapy)  Then an explanation/diagram about the surgery and sentinel node biopsy (mine were clear) radiotherapy was marked with 3 weeks mon-fri also hormone therapy marked tablets after rads 5-10years That's it! Some of the posts I have read have such detail and it's making me wonder if I should have questioned a little more. At the time I was happy to just let the professionals get on with it. I intended to ask more on my followup appointment but if you have seen my posts, my rads finished 16th Nov and I have had 2 cancelled followup appointments. Is it best to know or not to know? Were you told or did you have to ask?
Posts.Title: How much information should you be told

Posts.Content: Thank you all. it's good to know I'm not on my own. I'm still waiting for followup so it seems I have plenty of time to think. Probably air on the side of a need to know basis as I am a worrier X
Posts.Title: How much information should you be told

Posts.Content: Feb59 Hi I have been on Letrozol for nearly 9 weeks. I was terrified of taking it and said so on here but I took on board both negative and positive advice. In 9 weeks I have not had a single side effect. Maybe it is still lying in wait for me. I'm glad I took it now as it has given me peace of mind. Hope this helps a little  x
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: Feb59 Hi I have been on Letrozol for nearly 9 weeks. I was terrified of taking it and said so on here but I took on board both negative and positive advice. In 9 weeks I have not had a single side effect. Maybe it is still lying in wait for me. I'm glad I took it now as it has given me peace of mind. Hope this helps a little  x
Posts.Title: Letrezol

Posts.Content: I have my follow-up on Monday after lumpectomy. my surgeon did tell me at the beginning that if even one side of lump wasn't clear he would go back in and do a 'scrape' I'm preparing myself mentally for this but still hope for the best. It's tough when you feel you have come through the opp and preparing for the next step. sending hugs X
Posts.Title: Second Operation

Posts.Content: Wow HappyFeet1 that's a tremendous walk! I am trying to walk more. I do yoga twice a week and aqua fit once a week and trying to walk on the weekend(weather permitting) I live in Wales so it's usually raining! been up a couple of mountains and have just a moment ago been looking a walks in forest of dean ready for tomorrow. It's so easy to sit and do nothing but walking makes me feel so much better. Good on you and lovely photos
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: SFGS29 Thank you for your post. it has made me feel so much better. after the initial euphoria of not having to have chemo, I'm starting to panic about my 15 radiotherapy sessions. I have my first meeting with oncologist next Monday so I expect sessions will start very soon after. I really need to drive myself too and it's a 40min trip each way. I also need to work as I'm self employed. Your post has given me hope that I can do both.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - DIBH technique

Posts.Content: good luck earwig o i hope all goes well for you and you are finished for the big day x
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Halfway Mark today and boob slightly pink but all absolutely fine except I had my review. I now know that I will be going onto Letrozole after radiotherapy. I have to say that of all the things I have gone through, this I really don't want to do and almost scared enough to think about not taking it. I haven't read anything positive regarding it and feel that im now going to loose my quality of life. First time ive been really down and its a ******* pill thats causing it!
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Thank you maggiemee That's good to know as it looks so odd. They told me at hospital that this rash was normal. it started as a few spots under my boob and a little on top. I was told that it would peak at around 10days it's not sore and has been a little itchy but it's improving now. I've been so lucky and have just developed a slight burnt patch under my armpit. So good to know it should all fade x
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady56 what you say does make sense 're trip adviser thing. I am willing to put up with some side effects initially but not for 10 years. I'm self employed so I have to work and its quite a physical job. I eat healthily and do yoga and don't drink or smoke so maybe this helps. Lots of thinking, talking and reading 're letrozol for me but I do take on board what you have said X
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady56 Week one done for me no real side effects yet just a little ache around lymph node wound. I've been very lucky so far but very grateful to have two days off the commute! Onwards and upwards.
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: hi OCRKate I finished my rads 9 days ago. I just used the aloe Vera and E45. try and apply the moisturiser as often as you can and wear a crop top if you can. It's my 10th day post rads now and I have the brown rash under my boob and a slight burn under my arm and a slightly tender nip. They told me it would peak at 10days post so I'm a happy bunny right now. good luck for your remaining treatment
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: I had my last session yesterday!!! hurrah. I used E45 and aloe Vera only and have had no problems at all so far. I had my first Letrozol today so let's hope that my luck lasts. I'm saying this as a positive so that anyone who reads this can see that whilst radiotherapy can be horrendous for some, for others it can be straight forward. I have been told that symptoms can peak up to 7-10 days post therapy so I will keep you updated
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: I'm not sure if anyone can help but after radiotherapy my nipple is so dark almost black! will this lighten? Also anyone have any idea how long it will take for rash/spots to go?
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Hello Grandmasgirls I had grade 3 invasive lump last July. had a lumpectomy in August with sentinel node biopsy. I want told too much information and I didn't ask so as to triple Negative I'm not sure. I was told initially that chemo was more likely than not but it turned out, after lumpectomy not to be the case. also my lymph nodes were clear. I had 15 radiotherapy and am on letrozol for 5-10years. Sorry I cant be much help but rest assured we are all with you and I'm sure someone else will pop up on here soon. X
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy done

Posts.Content: My insurance was on a life cover for mortgage too. It was only a few £s extra at the time we took it out. Well worth it for those of us who have had to claim
Posts.Title: Well Women now Reassure cancer Insurance. Anyone had a claim in recently...

Posts.Content: Hi Beachwalker19 I had critical illness cover with Aviva that also covered breast cancer. that paid out. I wasnt sure it would as I didn't have chemotherapy but they said it wasnt the treatment but the diagnosis that counted. Sorted easily between them and breast care nurse
Posts.Title: Well Women now Reassure cancer Insurance. Anyone had a claim in recently...

Posts.Content: I absolutely love cold feet. My favourite line too is...its not fine, its shit and I have found myself using this on more than one occasion. I think we are so used to, when asked how we are to say oh I'm fine. I didn't have chemotherapy so when asked how I am by people who dont know what I've been through,  I do say I'm fine, when inside I'm screaming! I also think that this week when Jenny wanted everyone to stop smothering her, that was accurate for me.I have found that after pushing loved ones away initially for being so overbearing it's really hard to get them back. Unfortunately my husband has been working whilst this is on but I'm looking forward to him catching up with the series. I think it could prove to be an eye opener.
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: Has anyone had any problems getting Teva make of Letrozol? I thought they were a UK company so naively thought that it wouldn't be affected by Brexit. I'm starting to panic.
Posts.Title: Teva Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well today Mazzie5  Big HUGS X
Posts.Title: Nipple tassels or no nipple tassels?

Posts.Content: Ha ha ha that would be amazing Mazzie5 I would love to see their faces. Good luck for tomorrow. I didn't have a wire for lumpectomy but did for my lymph nodes as they were missed the first time! X
Posts.Title: Nipple tassels or no nipple tassels?

Posts.Content: I would agree with you. after finishing rads only a week ago I would think highly unlikely that anything sinister is there. they took scans of my boob halfway through and at the end of rads to check all was ok. I was fine after rads but as you say any lump fills you with dread. I think I have had delayed shock as all those feelings seem to be starting now 5 months on.
Posts.Title: Worried about lump

Posts.Content: hi Wigglewoo I was interested to read your post. I had lumpectomy last August and rads that finished 16th Nov. I have had my 3 appointments cancelled! so consequently have not seen anyone since my rads finished. I've had no problems except a lumpy boob. I've been reading on hear and wasnt unduly worried as many people find that after rads there are many lumps and bumps. I suppose we all have to get to know our new bodies. But, I am now going to insist on seeing someone re these lumps and get them checked out. I had never found my lump as it had shown on my 1st mammogram. I think I have been either a little too laid back or more likely a little scared. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Worried about lump

Posts.Content: I had Glenmark for my first month but was told by the pharmacist that this is not now on their list! I've taken a month of teva to try in the hope that as I didn't have any side effects with Glenmark I won't get any now. will keep you posted. Good luck in your search
Posts.Title: Clenmark Letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie I'm so sorry to hear this. You will find the strength to cope. That's why we are having these mammograms, to find it early. I have my first in July and am bricking it already. HUGS X
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time
